         </mrow>
        </msub>
       </mrow>
      </msup>
     </math></span> inserting the affine mapping&nbsp;(<a href="#M0035">17</a>) into the affine constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0009">4c</a>) and&nbsp;(<a href="#M0010">4d</a>) results in the affine constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0029">15c</a>) and&nbsp;(<a href="#M0030">15d</a>), respectively&nbsp;(Boyd &amp;&nbsp;Vandenberghe,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0005" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>2004</a></span>, p.&nbsp;79). Furthermore, the auxiliary variables are used to represent the ZCSs&nbsp;(<a href="#M0011">4e</a>) using convex functions&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0062.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0062.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mover>
         <mrow>
          <mrow>
           <mtext mathvariant="bold">
            h
           </mtext>
          </mrow>
         </mrow>
         <mo>
          ˆ
         </mo>
        </mover>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          z
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          c
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          s
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> in&nbsp;(<a href="#M0031">15e</a>). In order to get a QP problem, these constraints are assumed to be affine or approximated by affine inequality constraints. The application of space splitting for the convexification of the original constraints will be shown in more detail in Section&nbsp;<a href="#S002-S2003">2.3</a>. The splitting constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0032">15f</a>) and&nbsp;(<a href="#M0033">15g</a>) represent the constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0016">9a</a>) and&nbsp;(<a href="#M0017">9b</a>), respectively. These constraints are necessary to ensure that problem&nbsp;(15) correctly represents the original problem&nbsp;(4). They implement a bisection of selected decision variables at predefined transition values which are stored in the vector&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0063.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0063.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          w
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          t
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          r
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span>. The matrices&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0064.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0064.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          E
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          Σ
         </mi>
         <mo>
          ,
         </mo>
         <mi>
          k
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span>, <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0065.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0065.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          E
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          Δ
         </mi>
         <mo>
          ,
         </mo>
         <mi>
          k
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> and <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0066.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0066.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          E
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mi>
         z
        </mi>
        <mo>
         ,
        </mo>
        <mi>
         k
        </mi>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> are selection matrices extracting the desired decision variables. It is assumed that <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0067.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0067.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mfrac>
       <msub>
        <mi>
         n
        </mi>
        <mi>
         s
        </mi>
       </msub>
       <mn>
        2
       </mn>
      </mfrac>
     </math></span> decision variables are split at each collocation point.</p>
   <p>Depending on the individual approximations of the nonlinear constraints, the piecewise linear representation is subject to some error. The approximation error of this substitute problem is defined beforehand by the implemented number of space subdivisions. If the original problem is piecewise linear, this substitute problem can be an exact representation.</p><statement id="st3" content-type="remark">
    Remark 2.1 
    <p>Let <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0068.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0068.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msub>
        <mi>
         f
        </mi>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mi mathvariant="normal">
           n
          </mi>
          <mi mathvariant="normal">
           l
          </mi>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
       </msub><mo>
        (
       </mo><mi>
        w
       </mi><mo>
        )
       </mo>
      </math></span> represent a nonlinearity within a constraint depending on the decision variable representative&nbsp;<i>w</i>, as depicted in Figure&nbsp;<a href="#F0003">3</a>. Then, the total absolute error of the piecewise linear approximation <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0069.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0069.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msub>
        <mi>
         p
        </mi>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mi mathvariant="normal">
           p
          </mi>
          <mi mathvariant="normal">
           w
          </mi>
          <mi mathvariant="normal">
           l
          </mi>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
       </msub><mo>
        (
       </mo><mi>
        w
       </mi><mo>
        )
       </mo>
      </math></span> is given by the sum of absolute errors at each collocation point of the decision variable: <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0036.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0036.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0036" class="disp-formula-label">(18) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">
        <mtr>
         <mtd>
          <msub>
           <mi>
            e
           </mi>
           <mrow>
            <mrow>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              p
             </mi>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              w
             </mi>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              l
             </mi>
            </mrow>
           </mrow>
          </msub>
          <mo>
           =
          </mo>
          <munder>
           <mo>
            ∑
           </mo>
           <mrow>
            <mi>
             k
            </mi>
            <mo>
             ∈
            </mo>
            <mrow>
             <mrow>
              <mi>
               K
              </mi>
             </mrow>
            </mrow>
           </mrow>
          </munder>
          <mrow>
           <mo>
            |
           </mo>
          </mrow>
          <msub>
           <mi>
            f
           </mi>
           <mrow>
            <mrow>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              n
             </mi>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              l
             </mi>
            </mrow>
           </mrow>
          </msub>
          <mo>
           (
          </mo>
          <msub>
           <mi>
            w
           </mi>
           <mi>
            k
           </mi>
          </msub>
          <mo>
           )
          </mo>
          <mo>
           −
          </mo>
          <msub>
           <mi>
            p
           </mi>
           <mrow>
            <mrow>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              p
             </mi>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              w
             </mi>
             <mi mathvariant="normal">
              l
             </mi>
            </mrow>
           </mrow>
          </msub>
          <mo>
           (
          </mo>
          <msub>
           <mi>
            w
           </mi>
           <mi>
            k
           </mi>
          </msub>
          <mo>
           )
          </mo>
          <mrow>
           <mo>
            |
           </mo>
          </mrow>
          <mo>
           .
          </mo>
         </mtd>
        </mtr>
       </mtable>
      </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0036" class="disp-formula-label">(18) </span></span></span></span>An adequate number and position of knot points for the segmentation into piecewise linear parts achieve sufficiently small approximation errors. However, a higher number of splitting segments increases the size of the OP influencing the computation time.</p>

  <div id="S002-S2002-S3003" class="NLM_sec NLM_sec_level_3">
   <h4 class="section-heading-4" id="_i50">2.2.3. Nonconvex optimisation problem with convex feasible set</h4>
   <p>The absolute values in equality constraint&nbsp;(<a href="#M0033">15g</a>) still prohibit convexity. Deploying the theory of exact penalty functions&nbsp;(Di Pillo &amp;&nbsp;Grippo,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0013" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>1989</a></span>; Han &amp;&nbsp;Mangasarian,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0020" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>1979</a></span>), the absolute value equality constraints are moved to the objective without compromising optimality:</p><statement id="st4" content-type="theorem">
    Theorem 2.1 
    <p>Let <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0072.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0072.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mover>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">
           z
          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mo accent="false">
         ¯
        </mo>
       </mover>
      </math></span> be a stationary point of the OP <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0037.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0037.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0037" class="disp-formula-label">(19a) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">

                  <mrow>
                   <mtext mathvariant="bold">

       </mi>
      </math></span> representing the Lagrangian multipliers of the corresponding equality constraints. Since a <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">

         </mo>

         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">

         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </math></span> is an exact penalty function, <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0075.gif" alt="">

      <math>
       <mover>
        <mrow>

           z
          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mo accent="false">
         ¯
        </mo>
       </mover>
      </math></span> is a critical point of problem&nbsp;(15) for <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>

       </mn>

       <mi>

       </mi><mo>

       </mo><msub>
        <mrow>

           </mi>

        </mrow>

         </mi>

       </msub>

   </statement><statement id="st5" content-type="proof">
    Proof. 
    <p>The prerequisite for the optima recovery is that the optimality conditions are admissible for problem&nbsp;(15)&nbsp;(Nocedal &amp;&nbsp;Wright,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0039" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>2006</a></span>, p.&nbsp;507). For this purpose, the linear independence constraint qualification (LICQ)&nbsp;(Nocedal &amp;&nbsp;Wright,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0039" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>2006</a></span>, p.&nbsp;320) is analysed subsequently. Since the transformation&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0078.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0078.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mi mathvariant="bold">
        Φ
       </mi><mo>
        (
       </mo><mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          z
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow><mo>
        )
       </mo>
      </math></span> in&nbsp;(<a href="#M0035">17</a>) is affine, the gradients of the transformed basic constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0029">15c</a>) and&nbsp;(<a href="#M0030">15d</a>) remain linearly independent if the original constraints <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0079.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0079.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">
           c
          </mtext>
         </mrow>

        </mo>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>

          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mo>

        </mo>
        <mo>

        </mo>
        <msup>
         <mrow>
          <mi mathvariant="double-struck">
           R
          </mi>
         </mrow>
         <mrow>
          <msub>
           <mi>

           <mrow>
            <mi>

         </mrow>

       </mrow>
      </math></span> and <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0080.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0080.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">

      <noscript>

      <noscript>

      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0582.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">

      <noscript>

      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0041.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0041" class="disp-formula-label">(20a) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">
        <mtr>
         <mtd>

            <mrow>

          <msup>
           <mrow>

           <mrow>

      </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0041" class="disp-formula-label">(20a) </span></span></span></span> <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0042.gif" alt="">

      </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0042" class="disp-formula-label">(20b) </span></span></span></span>The gradients of the splitting constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0032">15f</a>) and&nbsp;(<a href="#M0033">15g</a>) are by definition linearly independent from each other and from the remaining constraints. Furthermore, it can be assumed without loss of generality that the gradients of the collocation constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0028">15b</a>), of the basic constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0029">15c</a>)–(<a href="#M0030">15d</a>) and of the ZCS-constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0031">15e</a>) are linearly independent. Thus, if the LICQ holds for the original problem&nbsp;(4), then it is also satisfied by the problem&nbsp;(15). By choosing a sufficiently small but positive smoothing parameter&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0081.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0081.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mn>
        0
       </mn><mo>
        &lt;
       </mo><msub>
        <mi>
         ϵ
        </mi>
        <mrow>
         <mi>
          s
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </msub><mo>
        ≪
       </mo><mn>
        1
       </mn>
      </math></span>, the prerequisite of continuous differentiable objective and constraint functions is given while approximation errors are kept small. Thus, the optimal solution will satisfy the Karush–Kuhn–Tucker conditions&nbsp;(Nocedal &amp;&nbsp;Wright,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0039" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>2006</a></span>, p.&nbsp;321).</p>
   </statement>
   <p>Constraints&nbsp;(<a href="#M0040">19d</a>) are added to enable omitting the norm in the objective as illustrated in&nbsp;(<a href="#M0037">19a</a>). Since <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0082.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0082.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          g
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          a
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          b
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          s
         </mi>
        </mrow>
        <mo>
         ,
        </mo>
        <mi>
         k
        </mi>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> is a vector of concave functions, the AVCs&nbsp;(<a href="#M0040">19d</a>) represent a convex set. Thus, the feasible set of OP&nbsp;(19) is convex.</p>
  </div>
  <div id="S002-S2002-S3004" class="NLM_sec NLM_sec_level_3">
   <h4 class="section-heading-4" id="_i57">2.2.4. Convex optimisation problem for iterative solution</h4>
   <p>From Theorem&nbsp;2.1 follows that solving&nbsp;(19) provides the solution for problem&nbsp;(15) assuming&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0083.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0083.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mi>
        ϵ
       </mi>
       <mrow>
        <mi>
         s
        </mi>
       </mrow>
      </msub><mo>
       &gt;
      </mo><mn>
       0
      </mn>
     </math></span>. Unfortunately, the augmented objective&nbsp;(<a href="#M0037">19a</a>) is nonconvex, which will be addressed via linearisation. Subsequently, the smoothing is removed by setting <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0084.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0084.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mi>
        ϵ
       </mi>
       <mrow>
        <mi>
         s
        </mi>
       </mrow>
      </msub><mo>
       =
      </mo><mn>
       0
      </mn>
     </math></span> since it will not be required for continuous differentiability. Omitting the smoothing represents an approximation to the smoothed version of&nbsp;(19); however, it is beneficial from a practical standpoint since the splitting constraints are exact for&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0085.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0085.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mi>
        ϵ
       </mi>
       <mrow>
        <mi>
         s
        </mi>
       </mrow>
      </msub><mo>
       =
      </mo><mn>
       0
      </mn>
     </math></span>. Furthermore, it enables representing the AVCs&nbsp;(<a href="#M0040">19d</a>) by two affine inequalities which yields exclusively affine constraints required for an LP and QP problem. For a convex OP, the absolute value of the AVCs in the augmented objective is linearised around the points&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0086.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0086.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msubsup>
       <mrow>
        <mover>
         <mrow>
          <mrow>
           <mtext mathvariant="bold">
            z
           </mtext>
          </mrow>
         </mrow>
         <mo>
          ~
         </mo>
        </mover>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mi>
         k
        </mi>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mo>
         ⋆
        </mo>
       </mrow>
      </msubsup><mo>
       ∈
      </mo><msup>
       <mrow>
        <mi mathvariant="double-struck">
         R
        </mi>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <msub>
         <mi>
          n
         </mi>
         <mi>
          s
         </mi>
        </msub>
       </mrow>
      </msup>
     </math></span> yielding the linearised constraints <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0043.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0043.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0043" class="disp-formula-label">(21a) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">

     </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0043" class="disp-formula-label">(21a) </span></span></span></span>which represent&nbsp;(<a href="#M0021">11b</a>), with the linearisation points being stored in matrix <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0044.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0044.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0044" class="disp-formula-label">(21b) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">
       <mtr>
        <mtd>
         <mtable columnalign="right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em">
          <mtr>
           <mtd>
            <mi mathvariant="bold">
             Σ
            </mi>
           </mtd>
           <mtd>
            <mfenced open="[" close="]">
             <mtable rowspacing="4pt" columnspacing="1em">
              <mtr>
               <mtd>
                <msub>

     </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0044" class="disp-formula-label">(21b) </span></span></span></span>Comparing&nbsp;(<a href="#M0033">15g</a>) and&nbsp;(<a href="#M0043">21a</a>) shows that the linearisation breaks down to a binary decision: choosing the correct sign of the absolute value term&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0087.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0087.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mover>
         <mrow>
          <mrow>
           <mtext mathvariant="bold">
            z
           </mtext>
          </mrow>
         </mrow>
         <mo>
          ~
         </mo>
        </mover>
       </mrow>
       <mi>
        k
       </mi>
      </msub>
     </math></span>. The linearisation&nbsp;(<a href="#M0043">21a</a>) is affine in the decision variables. Since the sum of convex functions preserves convexity&nbsp;(Boyd &amp;&nbsp;Vandenberghe,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0005" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>2004</a></span>, p.&nbsp;79), the composite objective function is then convex in the decision variables. With all constraints being affine, using linearisation&nbsp;(<a href="#M0043">21a</a>) results in the convex QP problem <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0045.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0045.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0045" class="disp-formula-label">(22a) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>

     </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0049" class="disp-formula-label">(22e) </span></span></span></span>For linear objectives&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0088.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0088.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mi>
       J
      </mi><mo>
       (
      </mo><mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mtext mathvariant="bold">
         w
        </mtext>
       </mrow>
      </mrow><mo>
       )
      </mo>
     </math></span>, the SSC approach results in a LP problem. The convex problem&nbsp;(22) is iteratively solved, whereas the linearisation points in <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0089.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0089.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mi mathvariant="bold">
       Σ
      </mi>
     </math></span> are updated based on the solution&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0090.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0090.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msup>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          z
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>

      </mo><mfenced open="[" close="]">

     </math></span> of the preceding iteration yielding <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0050.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0050.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0050" class="disp-formula-label">(23) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">
       <mtr>
        <mtd>
         <msubsup>

     </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0050" class="disp-formula-label">(23) </span></span></span></span>However, the question arises if replacing the constraint&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0091.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0091.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          g
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          a
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          b
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          s
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> in the objective with its linearisation&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0092.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0092.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          l
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          a
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          b
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          s
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> falsifies the solution. This motivates the following lemma:</p><statement id="st6" content-type="lemma">
    Lemma 2.2 
    <p>The satisfaction of <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0093.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0093.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msub>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">
           h
          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mi>
           a
          </mi>
          <mi>
           b
          </mi>
          <mi>
           s
          </mi>
         </mrow>
         <mo>
          ,
         </mo>
         <mi>
          k
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </msub><mo>
        (
       </mo><mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          z
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow><mo>
        )
       </mo><mo>
        ≥
       </mo><mn mathvariant="bold">
        0
       </mn>
      </math></span> and <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0094.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0094.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msub>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">
           l
          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mi>
           a
          </mi>
          <mi>
           b
          </mi>
          <mi>
           s
          </mi>
         </mrow>
         <mo>
          ,
         </mo>
         <mi>
          k
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </msub><mo>
        (
       </mo><mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          z
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow><mo>
        ,
       </mo><msubsup>
        <mrow>
         <mover>
          <mrow>
           <mrow>
            <mtext mathvariant="bold">
             z
            </mtext>
           </mrow>
          </mrow>
          <mo>
           ~
          </mo>
         </mover>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi>
          k
         </mi>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mo>
          ⋆
         </mo>
        </mrow>
       </msubsup><mo>
        )
       </mo><mo>
        =
       </mo><mn mathvariant="bold">
        0
       </mn>
      </math></span> concludes <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0095.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0095.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msub>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">
           g
          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mi>
           a
          </mi>
          <mi>
           b
          </mi>
          <mi>
           s
          </mi>
         </mrow>
         <mo>
          ,
         </mo>
         <mi>
          k
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </msub><mo>
        (
       </mo><mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          z
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow><mo>
        )
       </mo><mo>
        =
       </mo><mn mathvariant="bold">
        0
       </mn>
      </math></span>, independently of the linearisation point&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0096.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0096.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msubsup>
        <mrow>
         <mover>
          <mrow>
           <mrow>
            <mtext mathvariant="bold">
             z
            </mtext>
           </mrow>
          </mrow>
          <mo>
           ~
          </mo>
         </mover>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi>
          k
         </mi>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mo>
          ⋆
         </mo>
        </mrow>
       </msubsup>
      </math></span>.</p>
   </statement><statement id="st7" content-type="proof">
    Proof. 
    <p>This can be verified using Figure&nbsp;<a href="#F0002">2</a>(b) as graphical support. For this purpose, the following equations are given in general notation and are compared with the equations from the illustrative example in Section&nbsp;<a href="#S002-S2002-S3001">2.2.1</a> using the vector of decision variables <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">

      </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0055" class="disp-formula-label">(24e) </span></span></span></span>which represent the negative and positive branch of the AVC and are thus a subset: <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>

      <math>
       <msub>
        <mrow>

      </math></span>.</p>
   </statement>
   <p>This important lemma ensures that convergence of problem&nbsp;(22) to a solution which satisfies the linearised constraints&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0106.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0106.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">

     <noscript>

  <div id="S002-S2002-S3005" class="NLM_sec NLM_sec_level_3">
   <h4 class="section-heading-4" id="_i71">2.2.5. Space splitting convexification algorithm</h4>
   <p><span class="NLM_inline-graphic"><img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/medium/tcon_a_2004449_ilg0001.gif" alt=""></span></p>
   <p>Subsequently, the SSC algorithm&nbsp;1 is presented in detail and the proof of its convergence is provided. The algorithm inputs are described in line&nbsp;1. An initial solution for the inputs&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0108.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0108.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mrow>
       <msubsup>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">
           U
          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mn>
         0
        </mn>
        <mrow>
         <mo>
          ⋆
         </mo>
        </mrow>
       </msubsup>
       <mo>
        ∈
       </mo>
       <msup>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="double-struck">
          R
         </mi>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <msub>
          <mi>
           n
          </mi>
          <mi>
           u
          </mi>
         </msub>
         <mo>
          ×
         </mo>
         <msub>
          <mi>
           n
          </mi>
          <mrow>
           <mrow>
            <mi mathvariant="normal">
             p
            </mi>
            <mi mathvariant="normal">
             t
            </mi>
            <mi mathvariant="normal">
             s
            </mi>
           </mrow>
          </mrow>
         </msub>
        </mrow>
       </msup>
      </mrow>
     </math></span> and states&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0109.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0109.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msubsup>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          X
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mn>
        0
       </mn>
       <mrow>
        <mo>
         ⋆
        </mo>
       </mrow>
      </msubsup><mo>
       ∈
      </mo><msup>
       <mrow>
        <mi mathvariant="double-struck">
         R
        </mi>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <msub>
         <mi>
          n
         </mi>
         <mi>
          x
         </mi>
        </msub>
        <mo>
         ×
        </mo>
        <msub>
         <mi>
          n
         </mi>
         <mrow>
          <mrow>
           <mi mathvariant="normal">
            p
           </mi>
           <mi mathvariant="normal">
            t
           </mi>
           <mi mathvariant="normal">
            s
           </mi>
          </mrow>
         </mrow>
        </msub>
       </mrow>
      </msup>
     </math></span> must be provided. The algorithm iteratively solves the convex problem&nbsp;(22) using the solution of the previous iterate to correct the signs of the linearisation if necessary. The algorithm terminates when all signs are chosen correctly or the maximum number of iterations&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0110.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0110.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mi>
        q
       </mi>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          m
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          a
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          x
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> is reached. Thus, if the algorithm converges before reaching the maximum number of iterations&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0111.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0111.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mi>
       q
      </mi><mo>
       &lt;
      </mo><msub>
       <mi>
        q
       </mi>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          m
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          a
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          x
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span>, the largest constraint violation is smaller than a small value&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0112.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0112.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mover>
        <mi>
         l
        </mi>
        <mo accent="false">
         ¯
        </mo>
       </mover>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          a
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          b
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          s
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
      </msub><mo>
       ≤
      </mo><msub>
       <mi>
        ϵ
       </mi>
       <mi>
        g
       </mi>
      </msub>
     </math></span> with <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0113.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0113.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mrow>
       <mn>
        0
       </mn>
       <mo>
        ≤
       </mo>
       <msub>
        <mi>
         ϵ
        </mi>
        <mi>
         g
        </mi>
       </msub>
       <mo>
        ≪
       </mo>
       <mn>
        1
       </mn>
      </mrow>
     </math></span>. As already mentioned, the violation of the linearised AVCs indicates that a wrong sign was chosen. The reason why the constraint violations are a suitable feedback for correct sign selection can be visualised using Figure&nbsp;<a href="#F0002">2</a>(b). The signs and thus the linearised constraints&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0114.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0114.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mi>
        l
       </mi>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          a
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          b
         </mi>
         <mi mathvariant="normal">
          s
         </mi>
        </mrow>
        <mo>
         ,
        </mo>
        <mi>
         k
        </mi>
        <mo>
         ,
        </mo>
        <mi>
         j
        </mi>
       </mrow>
      </msub>
     </math></span> in the objective&nbsp;(<a href="#M0045">22a</a>) are fixed before optimisation. Then, running into the region of <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0115.gif" alt="">

     </math></span> due to the constraints&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0117.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0117.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <msub>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mtext mathvariant="bold">
          h
         </mtext>
        </mrow>
       </mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>

      </mo><mrow>
       <mrow>
        <mtext mathvariant="bold">

        </mtext>
       </mrow>
      </mrow>
     </math></span>, which in turn increases the linearised constraints in the objective. Based on the solution of the preceding iteration, the updating routine in line&nbsp;7 adjusts the convex QP problem&nbsp;(22) to satisfy&nbsp;(<a href="#M0032">15f</a>)–(<a href="#M0033">15g</a>) using the projection procedure&nbsp;(<a href="#M0023">12</a>): The update routine computes the projected initial solution&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0118.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0118.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mrow>
       <mover>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">
           Z
          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mo>
         ˘
        </mo>
       </mover>
      </mrow>
     </math></span> and the correct signs&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0119.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0119.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mi mathvariant="bold">
       Σ
      </mi>
     </math></span> for the linearisation of the AVCs. Afterwards, the optimiser is invoked in line&nbsp;8 to solve the convex QP problem or LP problem if the main objective is linear. The theory of exact penalty functions states that the penalty parameter&nbsp;<i>τ</i> must be larger than the largest optimal dual variable of the corresponding constraints. Since estimating the limit value for the penalty parameter is a rather complicated task, Algorithm&nbsp;1 pursues the straightforward approach in line&nbsp;6 of gradually increasing the penalty parameter up to a high value. A reasonably high but finite upper bound on the penalty parameter&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
     <noscript>
      <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0120.gif" alt="">
     </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0120.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
     <math>
      <mover>
       <mi>
        τ
       </mi>
       <mo accent="false">
        ¯
       </mo>
      </mover>
     </math></span> avoids numerical problems. Although this is not the best updating approach, it can work well in practice&nbsp;(Nocedal &amp;&nbsp;Wright,&nbsp;<span class="ref-lnk lazy-ref"><a data-rid="CIT0039" data-reflink="_i173 _i174" href="#"><span class="off-screen">Citation</span>2006</a></span>, p.&nbsp;511) as it is the case for the examples considered in this article.</p>
   <p>Finally, the following theorem verifies that the algorithm produces a sequence of solutions which eventually converges to a local solution satisfying the AVCs:</p><statement id="st8" content-type="theorem">
    Theorem 2.2 
    <p>Let the feasible set of problem&nbsp;(<a href="#M0045">22</a>) be denoted with <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">

       </mo>
      </math></span> Algorithm&nbsp;1 generates a sequence&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">

      <math>
       <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">

          </mo>
          <mn>
           1
          </mn>
          <mo>

          </mo>
          <mo>

          </mo>
         </mtd>
        </mtr>
       </mtable>
      </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0057" class="disp-formula-label">(26) </span></span></span></span>with <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0123.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0123.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">

      </math></span> being a convex function. This sequence eventually converges to a limit point&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>

       <msup>
        <mrow>
         <mrow>
          <mtext mathvariant="bold">

          </mtext>
         </mrow>
        </mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mo>

         </mo>
        </mrow>
       </msup>
      </math></span> which satisfies&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0125.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0125.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msub>
        <mrow>

   </statement><statement id="st9" content-type="proof">
    Proof. 
    <p>Algorithm&nbsp;1 iteratively solves problem&nbsp;(22) and gradually increases the penalty parameter up to a finite value&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0126.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0126.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mi>

       </mi><mo>
        ≤
       </mo><mover>
        <mi>

        </mi>
        <mo accent="false">

        </mo>
       </mover>
      </math></span>. Let the condition&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">

      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0127.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>

      <math>
       <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">

       </mtable>
      </math><span class="mathjaxLabel"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0058" class="disp-formula-label">(27) </span></span></span></span>This concludes that for every&nbsp;<span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0135.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0135.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <msub>
        <mi>
         ϵ
        </mi>
        <mrow>
         <mi>
          τ
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </msub><mo>
        &gt;
       </mo><mn>
        0
       </mn>
      </math></span>, there is a <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image inline-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0136.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_ilm0136.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula inline-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mrow>
        <mrow>
         <mi>
          Q
         </mi>
        </mrow>
       </mrow><mo>
        ∈
       </mo><mrow>
        <mi mathvariant="double-struck">
         N
        </mi>
       </mrow>
      </math></span> such that <span class="NLM_disp-formula-image disp-formula rs_preserve">
      <noscript>
       <img src="/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0059.gif" alt="">
      </noscript><img src="//:0" alt="" class="mml-formula" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;image&quot;, &quot;src&quot; : &quot;/na101/home/literatum/publisher/tandf/journals/content/tcon20/2023/tcon20.v096.i02/00207179.2021.2004449/20230130/images/tcon_a_2004449_m0059.gif&quot;}"><span class="mml-formula"><span class="disp_formula_label_div"><span id="M0059" class="disp-formula-label">(28) </span></span></span></span><span class="NLM_disp-formula disp-formula rs_preserve"><img src="//:0" alt="" data-formula-source="{&quot;type&quot; : &quot;mathjax&quot;}">
      <math>
       <mtable columnalign="right left right left right left right left right left right left" rowspacing="3pt" columnspacing="0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em 2em 0.278em">
        <mtr>
         <mtd>
          <msub>

              </mo>

          </mo>

           <mrow>
